event-group.description: Every time Loading the layout intialize the required GlobalVar's to default instead of setting all Globalvariables Defult
event-group.title: Initializing Global Variables

sub-events.comment: Creat aLocal storage for HighScore if doesn't Exist

event-group.description: Includes generation of all the objects in world
event-group.title: Generation MainLoop

sub-events.comment: If the player is above the scroll position, scroll up to the player's position.

When viewport reaches the nextfloorposition and if worldsection is still within decide worldlength, then create another floor at a random X an viewporttop-20 to avoid being visible to player. Add floorcount to local instance variable of floor - presentplatform to help us decide which floor to spawn powerups on for later use. Update nextfloorposition to a random of floorgap to some small seed value to make it look uneven.

A lot of stuff happens in this section of Code. - BIG COLLECTIBLE GENERATION SET that occurs at floor counts 90 to 100 or end of each worldsection. - ALL ENEMIES and POWERUP Collectibles - LOGIC for randomizing the number of candies that come in as normal collectibles on regular floors. - Types of FLOORS - Broken, Moving
- BIG COLLECTIBLE GENERATION SET. Considering, 90 to 100 floorcount as end of each worldsection and part of game where player should be rewarded.

Arranging Floors to left and right alternatively, so as to provide the player with jumping pattern enough to collect most of the big candy set. Also, the candies are generated using the floor's position as reference and then either adding to its X or substracting from it. The even count of floor are shifted to left and hence collectibles need to be generated adding to its X value. The odd floors are shifted to right, hence collectibles are generated substracting from its X as reference point. Movement simulation is taken care by ensuring that Y of candy is already overlapping during spawn with its movement markers.
Shield generation - DISABLED. Unsure of future use
ELECTRO OCTOPUS Gets unlocked after Worldsection 3. Appears 2 times for every world section after that.
SPIKY OCTOPUS Gets unlocked after Worldsection 1. Appears 3 times for every worldsection after that.
FLYING OCTOPUS Gets unlocked after Worldsection 2. Appears 3 times for every worldsection after that.
HYPERJUMP Mushroom Generation
RAINBOW Mushroom spawn
HEALTH Mushroom

GENERATING CANDIES Randomly for every random(1,4) Floorcount gap. Checking if current floor number is divisible by sequence of 4 to 1. Depending on which condition gets true, we decide the number of candies that should be generated on that floor. Else, if it skips all numbers, then that must be a prime platform and our random seed isnt 1.. in which case no candy is available on it.
BROKEN FLOOR
The logic for Broken behaviour of Broken floor is on another event sheet.
MOVING FLOORS. The logic for patrolling behaviour of moving floor is on another event sheet.
GENERATION OF BG - To be removed later.

event-group.description: Updating world section by Resetting Platformcount
event-group.title: Updating Difficulty

sub-events.comment: Updating world section by Resetting Platformcount. Each Worldsection consists of 101 Floors counting from 0 to 100.
Unlocking NEW candies for every 30 Floors
CAPPING max collectible animation changes to 15... as we have only 15 type of collectibles
Animation settings of Collectibles depending on Max unlocked value.
Magical hovering of Candies up and down is done by overlapping them with markers.

Same as generating collectibles during normal gameplay but with changes to make it the SET CHARACTER COLLECTIBLE at end of Game.
When viewport reaches the nextfloorposition and if worldsection is the last, then create floors to left and right of the screen. Then generate the LETTER COLLECTIBLE SET.
